column4: i have a command that I want to make an executable program, essentially, it's in my local /bin directory on a server, ow do I make it so I can run it?
no, a text file that just contains a command
i want to run t as a cron job
okay, i made it 764 though, will that do?
I don't want other users to execute it
no, it should be 754, because i want those in my group to execute, but not to write, and I don't want others to do anything but read
i'm the owner of the file, unop__, it's in ~/bin on a remote server, will it still run?
others shouldn't be able to write or execute
750 would like owner rw and execute group exec/read but not write and nothing for pub
i don't mind read acess for public, 754
but still, how do i make it run as a command in a terminal
you should be able to type it out
i don't have su access on this server, by the way, i want to run it as a user
